alert.note: Alert for Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 10:46AM EDT until May 04 at 1:01AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Bluffton IN affecting Wells County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Bluffton IN. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, River Road at Bluffton begins to flood. Flood waters isolate the amphitheater at Kehoe Park in Bluffton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 10.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
